title: Special Status of Scheduled Areas and Tribes in India

information.title: Constitutional Provisions
information.description: The Constitution of India provides special provisions for the administration and control of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes under the Fifth and Sixth Schedules.

information.title: Fifth Schedule
information.description: It deals with the administration and control of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes in any state except the four states of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

information.title: Sixth Schedule
information.description: It contains provisions for the administration of tribal areas in the four northeastern states of Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram.

information.title: Tribal Advisory Council
information.description: Under the Fifth Schedule, each state with Scheduled Areas must establish a Tribal Advisory Council to advise on matters pertaining to the welfare and advancement of the Scheduled Tribes.

information.title: Autonomous District Councils
information.description: The Sixth Schedule provides for the formation of Autonomous District Councils in tribal areas. These councils have legislative, judicial, and administrative powers.

information.title: Governor's Special Responsibility
information.description: The Governor of a state with Scheduled Areas has special responsibility to protect the interests of the Scheduled Tribes.

information.title: PESA Act, 1996
information.description: The Panchayats (Extension to Scheduled Areas) Act, 1996 extended the provisions of Panchayati Raj to the Scheduled Areas, giving special powers to Gram Sabhas.

information.title: Forest Rights Act, 2006
information.description: This Act recognizes the rights of forest-dwelling tribal communities and other traditional forest dwellers to forest resources.

quizQuestions.question: Which schedule of the Constitution deals with the administration of tribal areas in Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram?
What is established under the Fifth Schedule to advise on matters pertaining to the welfare of Scheduled Tribes?
Which Act extended the provisions of Panchayati Raj to the Scheduled Areas?
Who has special responsibility to protect the interests of Scheduled Tribes in states with Scheduled Areas?
Which Act recognizes the rights of forest-dwelling tribal communities to forest resources?
The Fifth Schedule of the Constitution applies to all states in India.
Autonomous District Councils have legislative, judicial, and administrative powers.
The PESA Act, 1996 gives special powers to Gram Sabhas in Scheduled Areas.
The Sixth Schedule applies to tribal areas in all northeastern states of India.
The Forest Rights Act, 2006 applies only to Scheduled Tribes and not to other traditional forest dwellers.
